Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: Today we covered the last material for the course (C15, C16, C17). I just uploaded what is probably the final version of the lecture notes. Next week (18 July) there will be no 8:30 lecture. From 10:15 to 11:45, I will review the material we have learned this semester.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: Oral exams for this course will be available on the following dates: Tue 23 July, Thu 25 July, Mon 29 July, Tue 30 July Tue 10 September Tue 1 October, Tue 8 October Both morning times (9:30-11:30) and afternoon times (13:00-15:00) will be available. More information about how to sign up for a particular time slot will be posted soon.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: The information about signing up for exams has now been posted on ISIS.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: I've uploaded an updated version of section C from the lecture notes. There are a few minor corrections and clarifications, especially in parts C10 and C12.

Messages.Author: Alexander Yves Fairley
Messages.Content: Dear students, Below are the links to the teaching evaluation surveys for the lectures and tutorials. It would be nice if you could complete the surveys. The deadline is 29 June. Lectures: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=8637W Tutorials: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=1LYHP Best, Alex

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: Because I've been sick this week, tomorrow's lectures will not be in person but instead by video. Videos will be posted here on ISIS tomorrow morning.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: Tomorrow there will only be one lecture, from 8:30 to 10:15 (so a little longer than the usual first half).

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Lectures tomorrow (18.4.) in MA 649 starting at 8:30

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: For the lectures on Thursday we were unfortunately assigned two different rooms, and I was initially unable to change this. Now I've been able to get MA 649 for both slots tomorrow. Hopefully this will work in future weeks as well, but there's no guarantee yet. To give everyone a few extra minutes of sleep, I will hold the lectures 8:30-10:00 and 10:15-11:45. See you tomorrow at 8:30 in MA 649.

Messages.Author: John Matthew Sullivan
Messages.Content: There's now confirmation from Innocampus that we can use MA 649 every Thursday for both lectures (8:30-10:00 and 10:15-11:45).

Messages.Author: Justin Noah Burack
Messages.Content: Hello everyone, I am still looking for a homework partner for this course. If interested, please message me per WhatsApp under 0176 7634 8824. Best regards, Justin
